description: Front elevationT1 Wisteria x 1 (Wisteria sinensis) This has now grown up on to the roof. It has become high maintenance, and there is concern that it may be damaging the brickwork and tiles. In addition to this, there are significant fears that the Wisteria could be accessed by external parties and thus poses a security risk to the property.Suggested works:- Fell to ground level by sectional takedown.Front gardenT2	Cabbage Palm x 1 (Cordyline australis) This tree is growing very close to the house and is in a poor condition.Suggested works:- Fell to ground level by sectional take downFront gardenT3	Mahonia x 1	This shrub is in poor condition to reinvigorate.Suggested works:- Reduce all round back to previous reduction points approx. 1.5mRear gardenT7	Pittosporum x 1 (Pittosporum tenuifolium tobira)  This tree is growing very close to the property and is severely blocking light from the ground floor.Suggested works:- Fell to ground level by sectional take downRear gardenT8	Pear x 1	(Pyrus communis) This tree is covered in creeper which has suppressed growth in places leaving the tree unbalanced. It is also blocking light from the garden.Suggested works:- Remove all creeper from crown- Reduce height by 3m to suitable growth points- Reduce over long laterals back into the main crown approx. 2m- Reduce back from garden by 0.5mneighbouring gardenT9	Cypress x 2	These trees covered in creeper are blocking light from garden.Suggested works:- Remove creeper- Reduce back to boundary approx. 1mRear gardenT10	Bamboo, Yellow x 1	(Phyllostachis aurea) Suggested works:	- Remove with rootsRear gardenT11	Himalayan Birch x 1 (Betula utilis) This medium sized tree is growing from a very small highly raised brick sided bed which is now damaged, suggesting a 	high risk of the tree failing.Suggested works:- Fell to ground level by sectional take downRear gardenT12	Holly x 1	(Ilex aquifolium)	To shape and contain.Suggested works:- Reduce in height ...
